verses.plain: I am the man that hath seen affliction by the rod of his wrath.

tokens.t: I
the man
hath seen affliction by the rod of his wrath.

verses.plain: He hath led me, and brought me into darkness, but not into light.

tokens.t: He hath led me, and brought
darkness, but not
light.

verses.plain: Surely against me is he turned; he turneth his hand against me all the day.

tokens.t: Surely against me is he turned; he turneth his hand
all the day.

verses.plain: My flesh and my skin hath he made old; he hath broken my bones.

tokens.t: My flesh and my skin hath he made old; he hath broken my bones.

verses.plain: He hath builded against me, and compassed me with gall and travail.

tokens.t: He hath builded against me, and compassed
with gall and travail.

verses.plain: He hath set me in dark places, as they that be dead of old.

tokens.t: He hath set me in dark places, as
dead of old.

verses.plain: He hath hedged me about, that I cannot get out: he hath made my chain heavy.

tokens.t: He hath hedged me about, that I cannot get out: he hath made my chain heavy.

verses.plain: Also when I cry and shout, he shutteth out my prayer.

tokens.t: Also when I cry and shout, he shutteth out my prayer.

verses.plain: He hath inclosed my ways with hewn stone, he hath made my paths crooked.

tokens.t: He hath inclosed my ways with hewn stone, he hath made my paths crooked.

verses.plain: He was unto me as a bear lying in wait, and as a lion in secret places.

tokens.t: He
unto me
a bear lying in wait,
a lion in secret places.

verses.plain: He hath turned aside my ways, and pulled me in pieces: he hath made me desolate.

tokens.t: He hath turned aside my ways, and pulled me in pieces: he hath made me desolate.

verses.plain: He hath bent his bow, and set me as a mark for the arrow.

tokens.t: He hath bent his bow, and set me as a mark for the arrow.

verses.plain: He hath caused the arrows of his quiver to enter into my reins.

tokens.t: He hath caused the arrows of his quiver to enter into my reins.

verses.plain: I was a derision to all my people; and their song all the day.

tokens.t: I was a derision to all my people;
their song all the day.

verses.plain: He hath filled me with bitterness, he hath made me drunken with wormwood.

tokens.t: He hath filled me with bitterness, he hath made me drunken with wormwood.

verses.plain: He hath also broken my teeth with gravel stones, he hath covered me with ashes.

tokens.t: He hath also broken my teeth with gravel stones, he hath covered me with ashes.

verses.plain: And thou hast removed my soul far off from peace: I forgat prosperity.

tokens.t: And thou hast removed my soul far off from peace: I forgat prosperity.

verses.plain: And I said, My strength and my hope is perished from the LORD:

tokens.t: And I said, My strength and my hope is perished from the

verses.plain: Remembering mine affliction and my misery, the wormwood and the gall.

tokens.t: Remembering mine affliction and my misery, the wormwood and the gall.

verses.plain: My soul hath them still in remembrance, and is humbled in me.

tokens.t: My soul hath
still in remembrance, and is humbled in me.

verses.plain: This I recall to my mind, therefore have I hope.

tokens.t: This I recall to my mind, therefore have I hope.

verses.plain: ¶ It is of the LORD’s mercies that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not.

tokens.t: the
mercies that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not.

verses.plain: They are new every morning: great is thy faithfulness.

tokens.t: new every morning: great
thy faithfulness.

verses.plain: The LORD is my portion, saith my soul; therefore will I hope in him.

tokens.t: The
my portion, saith my soul; therefore will I hope in him.

verses.plain: The LORD is good unto them that wait for him, to the soul that seeketh him.

tokens.t: The
good unto them that wait for him, to the soul
seeketh him.

verses.plain: It is good that a man should both hope and quietly wait for the salvation of the LORD.

tokens.t: good that
should both hope and quietly wait for the salvation of the

verses.plain: It is good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth.

tokens.t: good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth.

verses.plain: He sitteth alone and keepeth silence, because he hath borne it upon him.

tokens.t: He sitteth alone and keepeth silence, because he hath borne
upon him.

verses.plain: He putteth his mouth in the dust; if so be there may be hope.

tokens.t: He putteth his mouth in the dust; if so be there may be hope.

verses.plain: He giveth his cheek to him that smiteth him: he is filled full with reproach.

tokens.t: He giveth
cheek to him that smiteth him: he is filled full with reproach.

verses.plain: For the Lord will not cast off for ever:

tokens.t: For the Lord will not cast off for ever:

verses.plain: But though he cause grief, yet will he have compassion according to the multitude of his mercies.

tokens.t: But though he cause grief, yet will he have compassion according to the multitude of his mercies.

verses.plain: For he doth not afflict willingly nor grieve the children of men.

tokens.t: For he doth not afflict willingly nor grieve the children of men.

verses.plain: To crush under his feet all the prisoners of the earth,

tokens.t: To crush under his feet all the prisoners of the earth,

verses.plain: To turn aside the right of a man before the face of the most High,

tokens.t: To turn aside the right of a man before the face of the most High,

verses.plain: To subvert a man in his cause, the Lord approveth not.

tokens.t: To subvert a man in his cause, the Lord approveth not.

verses.plain: ¶ Who is he that saith, and it cometh to pass, when the Lord commandeth it not?

tokens.t: ¶ Who
he
saith, and it cometh to pass,
the Lord commandeth
not?

verses.plain: Out of the mouth of the most High proceedeth not evil and good?

tokens.t: Out of the mouth of the most High proceedeth not evil and good?

verses.plain: Wherefore doth a living man complain, a man for the punishment of his sins?

tokens.t: Wherefore doth a living man complain, a man for the punishment of his sins?

verses.plain: Let us search and try our ways, and turn again to the LORD.

tokens.t: Let us search and try our ways, and turn again to the

verses.plain: Let us lift up our heart with our hands unto God in the heavens.

tokens.t: Let us lift up our heart with
hands unto God in the heavens.

verses.plain: We have transgressed and have rebelled: thou hast not pardoned.

tokens.t: We have transgressed and have rebelled: thou hast not pardoned.

verses.plain: Thou hast covered with anger, and persecuted us: thou hast slain, thou hast not pitied.

tokens.t: Thou hast covered with anger, and persecuted us: thou hast slain, thou hast not pitied.

verses.plain: Thou hast covered thyself with a cloud, that our prayer should not pass through.

tokens.t: Thou hast covered thyself with a cloud, that
prayer should not pass through.

verses.plain: Thou hast made us as the offscouring and refuse in the midst of the people.

tokens.t: Thou hast made us
the offscouring and refuse in the midst of the people.

verses.plain: All our enemies have opened their mouths against us.

tokens.t: All our enemies have opened their mouths against us.

verses.plain: Fear and a snare is come upon us, desolation and destruction.

tokens.t: Fear and a snare is come upon us, desolation and destruction.

verses.plain: Mine eye runneth down with rivers of water for the destruction of the daughter of my people.

tokens.t: Mine eye runneth down with rivers of water for the destruction of the daughter of my people.

verses.plain: Mine eye trickleth down, and ceaseth not, without any intermission,

tokens.t: Mine eye trickleth down, and ceaseth not, without any intermission,

verses.plain: Till the LORD look down, and behold from heaven.

tokens.t: Till the
look down, and behold from heaven.

verses.plain: Mine eye affecteth mine heart because of all the daughters of my city.

tokens.t: Mine eye affecteth mine heart because of all the daughters of my city.

verses.plain: Mine enemies chased me sore, like a bird, without cause.

tokens.t: Mine enemies chased me sore, like a bird, without cause.

verses.plain: They have cut off my life in the dungeon, and cast a stone upon me.

tokens.t: They have cut off my life in the dungeon, and cast a stone upon me.

verses.plain: Waters flowed over mine head; then I said, I am cut off.

tokens.t: Waters flowed over mine head;
I said, I am cut off.

verses.plain: ¶ I called upon thy name, O LORD, out of the low dungeon.

tokens.t: ¶ I called upon thy name, O
, out of the low dungeon.

verses.plain: Thou hast heard my voice: hide not thine ear at my breathing, at my cry.

tokens.t: Thou hast heard my voice: hide not thine ear at my breathing, at my cry.

verses.plain: Thou drewest near in the day that I called upon thee: thou saidst, Fear not.

tokens.t: Thou drewest near in the day
I called upon thee: thou saidst, Fear not.

verses.plain: O Lord, thou hast pleaded the causes of my soul; thou hast redeemed my life.

tokens.t: O Lord, thou hast pleaded the causes of my soul; thou hast redeemed my life.

verses.plain: O LORD, thou hast seen my wrong: judge thou my cause.

tokens.t: O
, thou hast seen my wrong: judge thou my cause.

verses.plain: Thou hast seen all their vengeance and all their imaginations against me.

tokens.t: Thou hast seen all their vengeance
all their imaginations against me.

verses.plain: Thou hast heard their reproach, O LORD, and all their imaginations against me;

tokens.t: Thou hast heard their reproach, O
all their imaginations against me;

verses.plain: The lips of those that rose up against me, and their device against me all the day.

tokens.t: The lips of those that rose up against me, and their device against me all the day.

verses.plain: Behold their sitting down, and their rising up; I am their musick.

tokens.t: Behold their sitting down, and their rising up; I
their musick.

verses.plain: ¶ Render unto them a recompence, O LORD, according to the work of their hands.

tokens.t: ¶ Render unto them a recompence, O
, according to the work of their hands.

verses.plain: Give them sorrow of heart, thy curse unto them.

tokens.t: Give them sorrow of heart, thy curse unto them.

verses.plain: Persecute and destroy them in anger from under the heavens of the LORD.

tokens.t: Persecute and destroy them in anger from under the heavens of the

footnotes.text: covered…: or, rolled me in the ashes
recall…: Heb. make to return to my heart
the most High: or, a superior
